intro: Crotalaria barnabassii var. cunenensis, commonly known as the African horsebean, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and pinnately compound leaves. Its yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and the seeds are enclosed in hairy, elongated pods. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
